questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT
-

You have devices enrolled in Microsoft Intune as shown in the following table.

//IMG//


You need to identify the following:

• Device you can remove from Intune by using the Wipe action.
• The enrollment state and the associated user account can be retained on devices that are wiped.

What should you identify? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.

//IMG//

comments.content: In theory what you writing is right.. but if you test it you will discover that Intune can actually wipe (full wipe, personal data included) also personal Android and iOS devices

discussion.content:
> The Wipe action is not available for iOS/iPadOS devices enrolled with User Enrollment. 

> The Retain enrollment state and user account option is only available for Windows 10 version 1709 or later.

> Wipe isn't supported on:
- Android Enterprise personally owned devices with a work profile
- Linux


https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/mem/intune/remote-actions/devices-wipe#wipe

Based on Above:
Box1: 1 & 2 only
Box2: 1 & 2 only

Supported platforms for Wipe device action
Wipe is supported on the following platforms:

Android Enterprise Dedicated, Fully Managed, and Corporate-Owned Work Profile devices
Android Open Source Project (AOSP) devices
iOS/iPadOS
macOS
Windows
Wipe isn't supported on:

Android Enterprise personally owned devices with a work profile
Linux

Devices 1, 2 3, and 4 are supported for Wipe

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/mem/intune/remote-actions/devices-wipe

Wipe is supported on the following platforms:

Android Enterprise Dedicated, Fully Managed, and Corporate-Owned Work Profile devices
Android Open Source Project (AOSP) devices
iOS/iPadOS
macOS
Windows
Wipe isn't supported on:

Android Enterprise personally owned devices with a work profile
Linux

For wiping, this is the latest: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/mem/intune/remote-actions/devices-wipe Therefore ALL devices. 
The Enrolment state: READ Windows 10 V1709 or later

Device 1 & 2 for both. 
WIPE is not available on user enrolled iOS/iPAD device and personally enrolled Android devices.

Dev 1, 2, 3, 

Wipe is supported on the following platforms:

Android Enterprise Dedicated, Fully Managed, and Corporate-Owned Work Profile devices
Android Open Source Project (AOSP) devices
iOS/iPadOS
macOS
Windows

Note: The Wipe action is not available for iOS/iPadOS devices enrolled with User Enrollment. To create a User Enrollment profile

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/mem/intune/remote-actions/devices-wipe#supported-platforms-for-wipe-device-action

In the tenant I work in Company Portal is used for MDM enrollment on personal mobile devices where the users enroll using the "personal device" option. The wipe function for IOS and Android DEFINATELY IS AVAIALBE even after choosing personal device as the enrolling user. In the company documentation it is strictly not to be used unless the device is lost or stolen and the user requests it to be wiped. This is why it is available.

device 1 & 2 only : https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/mem/intune/remote-actions/devices-wipe#supported-platforms-for-wipe-device-action:~:text=than%2015%20minutes.-,Supported%20platforms%20for%20Wipe%20device%20action,-Wipe%20is%20supported




Device: 1 & 2 only https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/mem/intune/remote-actions/devices-wipe#supported-platforms-for-wipe-device-action:~:text=For%20Windows%2010%20version%201709%20or%20later%2C%20you,Expand%20table

Device:1,2 &4 if you ask me.

 Android Enterprise Dedicated, Fully Managed, and Corporate-Owned Work Profile devices

Device 3 (Android) is user enrolled and therefor has a work profile
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/mem/intune/remote-actions/devices-wipe#supported-platforms-for-wipe-device-action

Device 3 is user enrolled, meaning it will have a work profile and wipe action therefore is not supported.
"Wipe isn't supported on:

Android Enterprise personally owned devices with a work profile
Linux"
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/mem/intune/remote-actions/devices-wipe#supported-platforms-for-wipe-device-action
Correct me if ai am wrong
It seems given answers are correct

The important bit for the second option in the below doc is:
For Windows 10 version 1709 or later, you also have the Wipe device, but keep enrollment state and associated user account option. If this option is selected, the following user account details are retained.

comments.content: Answers are correct, it has been clearly explained in this MS Doc - https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/mem/intune/remote-actions/devices-wipe#supported-platforms-for-wipe-device-action

discussion.content:
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/mem/intune/remote-actions/devices-wipe#supported-platforms-for-wipe-device-action

I think the answers are correct

NNN

Device 1: Only devices enrolled to Intune can be used with Autopilot
Ref: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/autopilot/configuration-requirements#:~:text=Device%20registration.%20Devices%20must%20be%20added%20to%20Windows%20Autopilot%20to%20support%20most%20Windows%20Autopilot%20scenarios.

Device 2: Excluded by policy

Device 3: This one says Restart. If that's true then the answer would be No. If it's meant to say Reset, then the answer would be Yes.

NNN if the 3rd question is actually "Restart" 
NNY if the 3rd question is "Reset". 

Convert to Windows Autopilot - This really means that Intune will automatically ask the device for its HWID and upload it. But for that to happen, the device needs to be enrolled to Intune. In this case Device1 is simple Entra Joined and not Intune enrolled so this setting doesn't take effect. Hence answer for 1st one is No until someone manually uploads the hash or enrolls it to intune.

comments.content:
Device1: Not enrolled in Intune, hardware hash not registered, so Autopilot deployment won't occur on reset.
Device2: Excluded from the Autopilot deployment profile (via Group2), so it won't use Autopilot on reset.
Device3: Restarting doesn't trigger Autopilot deployment; it only occurs during initial setup or reset.
No, it needs to be enrolled in Intune so it can take the hash. Device 1 will not be deployed as AP until it is enrolled.

discussion.content:
YNN

Device 1: It's included in the autopilot profile that states "Convert all targeted devices to Autopilot," so it will be deployed by autopilot.

Device 2: Is excluded.

Device 3: Restart does not have autopilot actions.

Y, Device is Entra ID joined. Which means the hw hash is already imported, but not yet enrolled in Intune.

N, Device2 is excluded

N, Restarting does nothing

comments.content: Entra ID joining has nothing to do with hashes. They need to be bulk imported or singly imported into Intune, not Entra ID. You're confusing PRT tokens with device hashes.
my take would be NNY ? But I have a doubt with the 3d one, does a RESTART perform anything of the sort? Otherwise it would be NNN. If more peeps would have a think.....

discussion.content:
Requirements
An existing device can automatically register if it's:

Running a supported version of Windows
Enrolled in an MDM service such as Intune
A corporate device that isn't already registered with Autopilot
For devices that meet these requirements, the MDM service can ask the device for the hardware hash. After it has that, it can automatically register the device with Windows Autopilot.
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/autopilot/automatic-registration

comments.content: First device is not enrolled or not run via autopilot. so reseting this device wont help, device 2 in Group2 thats in exclusion group, device3 restarting wont deploy only reseting so NNN

discussion.content: for me it should be YNY

Device 2 is in group 2 so will not be deployed.
Device 3 is in Azure and intune so will be deployed.

Device 1 I suppose not, as it doesn not say the csv has been uploaded with the hardware hash

comments.content: Cool, I hadn't known about the priority under settings

Good catch! A simple change in that would have thrown off the entire question. 

I agree with the answers. 

TB1 will not download anything from MDT3 because it's in a different subnet all together. 
DT1 will use the British keyboard because the Default Gateway IP is within the given subnet range
LT1 will download the image from MDT1 because it's Default Gateway IP is also part of it's respective subnet.

Since many of the settings stored under the Default header may be used in the previous sections, the Default header is often used as a catchall. The settings contained here are applicable to all devices that connect to the deployment share

https://www.techrepublic.com/article/microsoft-deployment-toolkit-advanced-settings-for-automating-deployments-using-bootstrap-ini/

discussion.content:
Answer looks correct
[Settings] sets the priority
so [Default Gateway] first, then [Default]
https://www.techrepublic.com/article/microsoft-deployment-toolkit-advanced-settings-for-automating-deployments-using-bootstrap-ini/

comments.content: Where does it state that MDT is no longer in the exam? And why is MDT still in the MD-102 learning path in Ms learn?

MS learn is not updated regularly, you should check the study guide for the latest material. There you see all the most recent changes and updates too. Also, what you need to know from 17th of september.

discussion.content:
as a reminder, Mdt has been withdrawn from the examination since 26/04
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-US/credentials/certifications/resources/study-guides/md-102

comments.content:
I used following in my bootstrap file and my computer gateway was the same as NetA. After loging in to the share I was presented with task sequences in my DeployB$ share. 


[Settings]
Priority=DefaultGateway, Default

[DefaultGateway]
192.168.175.2=NetA
192.168.176.2=NetB

[NetA]
DeployRoot=\\192.168.175.1\DeployA$
KeyboardLocale=nl-nl

[NetB]
DeployRoot=\\192.168.175.1\DeployB$
KeyboardLocale=en-gb

[Default]
DeployRoot=\\192.168.175.1\DeployB$
KeyboardLocale=en-us

discussion.content:
Well I have tested this in my own test enviroment.

The settings in [default] overrule anything else as far as I can test.
Y,N,N would be my answer. Exact the opossite of given answers.

Selected Answer: AD
Answers are correct

keywords are Managed and Enterprise

Selected Answer: AD
confirmed this in my tenant.

Android Enterprise System App

correct

questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft 365 subscription that contains 1,000 Android devices enrolled in Microsoft Intune.

You create an app configuration policy that contains the following settings:

• Device enrollment type: Managed devices
• Profile Type: All Profile Types
• Platform: Android Enterprise

Which two types of apps can be associated with the policy? Each correct answer presents a complete solution.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D. Device1, Device2, and Device3 only

When it comes to apps, Intune supports the following platforms:

Windows
iOS/iPadOS
macOS
Android

Ref: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/solutions/apps-add-step-1?view=o365-worldwide#determine-the-platforms-needed-for-each-app

Selected Answer: D
D is correct.Linux isn't supported.

Selected Answer: D
Correct option is D, as Linux devices aren't supported by Microsoft Intune.

Selected Answer: D
We cannot deploy apps to Linux using Intune.

Selected Answer: D
Linux is (still) NOT supported for app deployment
ChatGPT says E
I think answer D is correct. 1 2 and 3. Linux devices are not supported by Intune.

Selected Answer: C
ChatGPT: As of my last knowledge update in January 2022, Microsoft Intune primarily focuses on managing and securing Windows, iOS, Android, and macOS devices. At that time, Ubuntu Linux was not officially supported for app deployment through Microsoft Intune.

Just device 1,2,3 and not to be confused with the fact there is an Intune App for Linux which serves for the enrollment and compliance policies reporting:
https://ubuntu.com/blog/ubuntu-compliance-monitoring-with-microsoft-intune#:~:text=Intune%20for%20Linux%20brings%20device,cloud%2Dfirst%20IT%20administration%20model
D - it is not possible to deploy apps for Linux

Just devices 1, 2 and 3 I think.

I dont see Linux in the By Platform section of the Apps overview in my Intune tenant.

questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft 365 subscription.

You have devices enrolled in Microsoft Intune as shown in the following table.

//IMG//


To which devices can you deploy apps by using Intune?
